sentences.en: Don't stint yourself; take all you want.
sentences.cn: 不要限制自己, 想要多少拿多少.

sentences.en: Everybody must do a daily stint in the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 每个人都应该每天在厨房里干点活儿.

sentences.en: He came back into a stint as a university president.
sentences.cn: 在从政之前,盖茨曾当过大学校长.

sentences.en: He did a two - year stint in the army when he left school.
sentences.cn: 他离开学校后服兵役两年.

sentences.en: He is returning to this country after a five-year stint in Hong Kong.
sentences.cn: 他在香港工作了5年后即将回国。

sentences.en: He lavished money on his children without stint.
sentences.cn: 他在孩子们身上花钱毫不吝惜.

sentences.en: He returns to the Czech capital following a two - year stint with Bordeaux.
sentences.cn: 他在效力了波尔多两年后,又返回了捷克首都.

sentences.en: Her stint as a lifeguard usually consumes three hours a day.
sentences.cn: 救生员这项工作每天通常花费她三个小时.

sentences.en: I have to stint myself of food.
Looking up at the sky a stint, is to find a month!
sentences.cn: 抬头看天,一星半点, 是找不到月!

sentences.en: Lynch avoids making explicIt'stock recommendations, but he does not stint with examples.
sentences.cn: 林奇避免作出明确的股票推荐, 但他并不用例子忐忑不安.

sentences.en: Then I had a stint as security officer in Hong Kong.
sentences.cn: 我那时在香港做过一阵护卫员.

sentences.en: We hope that you will not stint your criticism.
When you make this recipe, don't stint on the butter.
sentences.cn: 当你照食谱做这菜时, 要多用奶油.

trans.tran_cn: 定额，定量，限额，限量，节约，[鸟]滨鹬

trans.tran_en: to provide or use too little of something
